name: Change login shell
description: An adversary may want to use a different login shell. The chsh command changes the user login shell. The following test, creates an art user with a /bin/bash shell, changes the users shell to sh, then deletes the art user.

data.command:
[ "$(uname)" = 'FreeBSD' ] && pw useradd art -g wheel -s /bin/csh || useradd -s /bin/bash art
cat /etc/passwd |grep ^art
chsh -s /bin/sh art
cat /etc/passwd |grep ^art

steps.name: Check dependency 1/1
steps.description: chsh - change login shell, must be installed

data.command: if [ -f /usr/bin/chsh ]; then echo "exit 0"; else echo "exit 1"; exit 1; fi

steps.name: Resolve dependency 1/1
steps.description: chsh - change login shell, must be installed

data.command: echo "Automated installer not implemented yet, please install chsh manually"
